description: A new proof shows that a knot some thought would contradict the famed slice-ribbon conjecture doesn’t. The post Mathematicians Eliminate Long-Standing Threat to Knot Conjecture first appeared on Quanta Magazine
author: Leila Sloman

title: Machines Learn Better if We Teach Them the Basics
description: A wave of research improves reinforcement learning algorithms by pre-training them as if they were human. The post Machines Learn Better if We Teach Them the Basics first appeared on Quanta Magazine
author: Max G. Levy

title: When Does the Brain Operate at Peak Performance?
description: The critical brain hypothesis suggests that neural networks do their best work when connections are not too weak or too strong. The post When Does the Brain Operate at Peak Performance? first appeared on Quanta Magazine
author: John M. Beggs

title: Astronomers Say They Have Spotted the Universe’s First Stars
description: Theory has it that “Population III” stars brought light to the cosmos. The James Webb Space Telescope may have just glimpsed them. The post Astronomers Say They Have Spotted the Universe’s First Stars first appeared on Quanta Magazine
author: Jonathan O'Callaghan

title: How Quantum Physicists ‘Flipped Time’ (and How They Didn’t)
description: Two teams have made photons act as if time were simultaneously flowing in two directions. The experiments demonstrate a way to potentially boost the performance of quantum devices. The post How Quantum Physicists ‘Flipped Time’ (and How They Didn’t) first app…
author: Charlie Wood

title: The Cause of Depression Is Probably Not What You Think
description: Depression has often been blamed on low levels of serotonin in the brain. That answer is insufficient, but alternatives are coming into view and changing our understanding of the disease. The post The Cause of Depression Is Probably Not What You Think first a…
author: Joanna Thompson

title: The Computer Scientist Who Finds Life Lessons in Games
description: In Shang-Hua Teng’s work, theoretical and practical questions have long been intertwined. Now he’s turning his focus to the impractical. The post The Computer Scientist Who Finds Life Lessons in Games first appeared on Quanta Magazine
author: Ben Brubaker

title: Mathematicians Find an Infinity of Possible Black Hole Shapes
description: In three-dimensional space, the surface of a black hole must be a sphere. But a new result shows that in higher dimensions, an infinite number of configurations are possible The post Mathematicians Find an Infinity of Possible Black Hole Shapes first appeared…
author: Steve Nadis

title: The Basic Algebra Behind Secret Codes and Space Communication
description: Whether you’re passing secret notes in class or downloading images from a space probe, Reed-Solomon codes offer an ingenious way to embed information and correct for errors. The post The Basic Algebra Behind Secret Codes and Space Communication first appeared…
author: Patrick Honner

title: Social Vulnerability Shapes the Experiences of Climate Migrants Displaced by Hurricane Maria
description: The purpose of this study is to understand the experiences of climate change related migrants. To do so we draw on focus group discussions with Puerto Ricans in South and Central Florida displaced by 2017 Hurricane Maria.
author: Aaron Clark-Ginsberg; Linda Sprague Martinez; Carolina Scaramutti; José Rodríguez; Christopher P. Salas-Wright; Seth J. Schwartz

title: The Opioid Use Disorder Core Outcomes Set (OUD–COS) for Treatment Research
description: The aim of this study was to develop the US National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA) National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network (CTN) opioid use disorder core outcomes set (OUD–COS).
author: Niranjan S. Karnik; John Marsden; Connor McCluskey; Randy A. Boley; Katharine A. Bradley; Cynthia I. Campbell; Megan E. Curtis; David Fiellin; Udi Ghitza; Kathryn Hefner; Yih-Ing Hser; R. Kathryn McHugh; Sterling M. McPherson; Larissa J. Mooney; Landhing M. Moran; Sean M. Murphy; Robert P. Schwartz; Dikla Shmueli-Blumberg; Matisyahu Shulman; Kari A. Stephens; Katherine E. Watkins; Roger D. Weiss; Li-Tzy Wu

title: Potential Implications of the Russia–Ukraine War for Northeast Asia
description: Commentary on potential lessons from the Russia–Ukraine war bearing on deterrence in Northeast Asia, including lessons related to nuclear weapons.
author: Paul K. Davis

title: Broad and Selectively Deep
description: To aid policy analysis and decision making, projects should use models and simulations of varied resolution and perspective. This can improve analysis, improve communication, and provide a broad view, necessary detail, and alternative views.
author: Paul K. Davis

title: Exploring Chinese Thinking on Deterrence in the Not-So-New Space and Cyber Domains
description: This conference volume chapter explores evolving Chinese thinking on space and cyber deterrence. Besides nuclear deterrence, the space and cyber domains are viewed by China as its main means of strategic deterrence.
author: Nathan Beauchamp-Mustafaga

title: The Role of Pre-Treatment Traumatic Stress Symptoms in Adolescent Substance Use Treatment Outcomes
description: This study assesses the association between traumatic stress symptoms and substance use treatment outcomes among trauma-exposed adolescents, using methods to reduce potential confounding from factors such as baseline substance use severity.
author: Donna L. Coffman; Lynsay Ayer; Megan S. Schuler; Mark D. Godley; Beth Ann Griffin

title: Staying the Unfavorable Course
description: The U.S. policy goal of preventing Afghanistan from becoming a haven for terrorists remained constant for 20 years even as the dynamics of the war and the will of the policymaking community changed and there was no apparent hope of military victory. Why?
author: Matthew Sargent; Jason H. Campbell; Alexandra T. Evans; Caitlin McCulloch; Jordan R. Reimer; Richard S. Girven

title: Universal Command and Control Language Early System Engineering
description: In a multiyear effort, RAND researchers analyzed the challenges of creating a universal command and control language to facilitate the evolution of systems and interoperability of systems-of-systems for the U.S. Department of Defense.
author: James Dimarogonas; Jasmin Léveillé; Jan Osburg; Shane Tierney; Bonnie L. Triezenberg; Graham Andrews; Bryce Downing; Muharrem Mane; Monica Rico

title: RAND Experts on Veteran Mental Health Respond to the White House Mental Health Research Priorities
description: The White House identified eight research priorities to better manage America's current mental health crisis. RAND researchers highlight why each area is critical for veteran mental health and how RAND is contributing to address them.
author: Rajeev Ramchand; Carrie M. Farmer; Joshua Breslau; Sarah B. Hunter; Ryan K. McBain

title: Ohio's Train Derailment—Not Spy Balloons—Is the Real National Security Threat
description: The slow degradation of infrastructure and disaster response is less a spectacle than an overflying balloon, but the train derailment and chemical spill in Ohio highlights just how bizarre such a focus on perceived external national security threats has becom…
author: Bradley Martin; Aaron Clark-Ginsberg

title: Little in Common
description: In a world now dominated by U.S. strategic competition with Russia and China, the obstacles to cooperation—particularly the absence of trust—are growing. Cooperation will be rare and narrowly focused, often limited to making strategic competition
author: Raphael S. Cohen; Elina Treyger; Nathan Beauchamp-Mustafaga; Asha Clark; Kit Conn; Scott W. Harold; Michelle Grisé; Marta Kepe; Soo Kim; Ashley L. Rhoades; Roby Valiaveedu; Nathan Vest

title: Vanishing Trade Space
description: To what extent can the United States still cooperate with China and Russia even in this era of strategic competition? This report, the first of a four-part series, presents the overarching findings of a study that explored this question.
author: Raphael S. Cohen; Elina Treyger; Nathan Beauchamp-Mustafaga; Asha Clark; Kit Conn; Scott W. Harold; Michelle Grisé; Marta Kepe; Soo Kim; Ashley L. Rhoades; Roby Valiaveedu; Nathan Vest

title: Assessing the Prospects for Great Power Cooperation in Europe and the Middle East
description: This report, part of a four-part series, describes the potential for U.S. cooperation with China or Russia in Europe and the Middle East across seven issue areas.
author: Elina Treyger; Ashley L. Rhoades; Nathan Vest; Nathan Beauchamp-Mustafaga; Raphael S. Cohen; Asha Clark

title: Assessing the Prospects for Great Power Cooperation in the Indo-Pacific
description: This report, part of a four-part series, describes the potential for U.S. cooperation with China or Russia in the Indo-Pacific across seven issues, including securing a free and open Indo-Pacific and the denuclearization of North Korea.
author: Scott W. Harold; Nathan Beauchamp-Mustafaga; Soo Kim

title: Assessing the Prospects for Great Power Cooperation in the Global Commons
description: This report, part of a four-part series, describes the potential for U.S. cooperation with China or Russia on global commons issues, including freedom of access to space, countering violent extremist organizations, and promoting global stability.
author: Raphael S. Cohen; Marta Kepe; Nathan Beauchamp-Mustafaga; Asha Clark; Kit Conn; Michelle Grisé; Roby Valiaveedu; Nathan Vest

title: One Year After Russia's Invasion of Ukraine: Experts React
description: We asked nearly 30 RAND experts to highlight takeaways from the first year of Russia's all-out war—and share what they're watching as the conflict in Ukraine grinds on. Here's what they said.
author: Dara Massicot; Samuel Charap; Raphael S. Cohen; John Tefft; Miranda Priebe; William Courtney; Michael J. Mazarr; Gian Gentile; Bryan Frederick; Shelly Culbertson; Jason Matheny; Howard J. Shatz; Todd C. Helmus; Stephanie Pezard; Bruce McClintock; Scott Savitz; Stephen J. Flanagan; Alyssa Demus; Christopher Paul; Karl P. Mueller; John V. Parachini; J.D. Williams; Colin David Smith; Charles P. Ries; David A. Shlapak; Clint Reach; Andrew Radin

title: Earthquake in Turkey and Syria, Facial Recognition, Gun Violence: RAND Weekly Recap
description: This weekly recap focuses on the devastating earthquake that struck Turkey and Syria, regulating the use of facial recognition technology by law enforcement, improving data collection on gun violence, and more.
author: RAND Corporation

title: Russia's Appetite May Extend Beyond Ukraine
description: Unless Russian forces are defeated in Ukraine or withdrawn by new Kremlin rulers, Moscow might assault other post-Soviet neighbors. The West may face limits on the extent to which it could help them thwart such attacks.
author: William Courtney

title: RAND Experts Take to Twitter Spaces for Live Conversation About the 1-Year Anniversary of Russia's Full-Scale Invasion of Ukraine
description: As the anniversary of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine approaches, RAND will bring together several of its top experts for a live, moderated conversation on Twitter Spaces. Experts will discuss the past 12 months of war and the paths that lie ahead fro…
author: RAND Corporation

title: Great Power Competition Is on the Arctic Agenda
description: Despite its military problems in Ukraine, Russia remains a formidable potential adversary in the Arctic. And there is a growing realization that China is not going away in the Arctic, bringing both of the United States' strategic competitors into Alaska's bac…
author: Abbie Tingstad; Yuliya Shokh

title: American School District Panel Interactive Survey Results Tool
description: This tool allows users to compare superintendents' responses to the fall 2022 American School District Panel survey. Charts display results for all respondents and by locale, student race and ethnicity, and district poverty level.
author: Gerald P. Hunter; Melissa Kay Diliberti; Heather L. Schwartz

title: Educator Turnover Has Markedly Increased, but Districts Have Taken Actions to Boost Teacher Ranks
description: Researchers analyzed district leader survey results to see whether educator turnover increased nationally at the end of the 2021–2022 school year and to learn whether districts continued to experience staff shortages during the 2022–2023 school year.
author: Melissa Kay Diliberti; Heather L. Schwartz

title: Technical Documentation for the Sixth American School District Panel Survey
description: This report provides technical information about the fall 2022 survey of the American School District Panel. The authors describe the survey administration and weighting processes they used to produce nationally representative estimates.
author: David Grant; Claude Messan Setodji; Gerald P. Hunter; Melissa Kay Diliberti

title: Preventing Military Sexual Assault Is Important. So Is Getting Mental Health Care Afterward
description: Despite a decade of scrutiny on the issue, sexual assault and harassment in the military is still a pervasive problem. The effects of the trauma from these assaults can be lasting. So it's not just the military services, but also veterans' services, that need…
author: Julia Rollison

title: Why Is North Korea Showing Off Its ICBMs?
description: On February 8, North Korea held a military parade in Pyongyang to call attention to the strengths of the North's military weapons, including what appeared to be 11 intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs). Can the United States and its allies afford to wai…
author: Bruce W. Bennett; Young-jun Kim

title: Preparing for the Next India-China Border Crisis
description: Mounting tensions between India and China due to Chinese encroachment on their disputed border affect the United States and its Indo-Pacific strategy. Washington should assist New Delhi in deterring further Chinese attempts to nibble away at Indian territory …
author: Lisa Curtis; Derek Grossman

title: Brain and Machine Confluence Requires Multi-Sectoral Regulation To Maximize Gains
description: As the commercialization of brain-computer interface technology expands, it would be prudent for international policymakers to consider how this technology should be regulated, in order to reap its benefits and minimize its risks.
author: Sana Zakaria; Joana Gomes Beirao; Timothy Marler

title: The Impact of Natural Disasters on Education in the United States and its Territories
description: In this webinar, three RAND researchers will discuss their work exploring the effect of disasters on education. The Disaster Management & Resilience Program webinar series was created to increase understanding of how disaster policies can affect the ability o…
author: RAND Corporation

title: Support to Ukraine Continues to Be for America First
description: Why should the United States spend tens of billions of dollars on a war half a world away? Because it's in America's economic and strategic interests.
author: Raphael S. Cohen; Gian Gentile

title: What Russia Got Wrong
description: Russia's struggles in Ukraine cannot be explained only as endemic military problems. Is Russia capable of learning from its failures?
author: Dara Massicot

title: Racial Disparities in Criminal Sentencing Vary Considerably Across Federal Judges
description: Substantial race-based disparities exist in federal criminal sentencing. We analyze 380,000 recent (2006–2019) sentences in the JUSTFAIR database and show that these disparities are large and vary considerably across judges.
author: Nicholas Goldrosen; Christian Michael Smith; Maria-Veronica Ciocanel; Rebecca Santorella; Shilad Sen; Shawn D. Bushway; Chad M. Topaz

title: Finding a Broadly Practical Approach for Regulating the Use of Facial Recognition by Law Enforcement
description: Facial recognition technology is developing rapidly and is increasingly being used in policing. What do policymakers need to understand in order to minimize the risks it poses, while also maximizing its benefits?
author: Samuel Peterson; Brian A. Jackson; Dulani Woods; Elina Treyger

title: The Cost of Cost-Effectiveness
description: Researchers offer ways the Federal Emergency Management Agency could simplify or amend the required benefit–cost analysis process in applications for hazard mitigation assistance to be more inclusive of lower-resourced communities.
author: Benjamin M. Miller; Noreen Clancy; Douglas C. Ligor; Geoffrey Kirkwood; David Metz; Steven Koller; Stephanie Stewart

title: Harnessing Mobile Technology to Enable U.S. Personnel Vetting
description: The authors examined how U.S. government vetting could be enhanced with mobile technologies and platforms for the Security, Suitability, and Credentialing Performance Accountability Council Program Management Office.
author: David Stebbins; Sarah W. Denton; Douglas Yeung

title: Considering Justice Policy in the 118th Congress
description: What are the biggest justice policy policy issues facing the 118th Congress? RAND experts offer up insight on a variety of justice topics in recent years, including drug policy, gun policy, health care consolidation and integration, violent extremism, and mor…
author: RAND Corporation

title: Earthquake in Turkey, Syria: Insights from RAND Researchers
description: More than 36,000 people have been confirmed dead in one the strongest earthquakes to hit Turkey and Syria in the past century. As search-and-rescue missions continue and recovery begins, a handful of RAND researchers shared some of their initial thoughts.
author: Shelly Culbertson; Aaron Clark-Ginsberg; Howard J. Shatz; James A. Schear; Krishna B. Kumar; Mahshid Abir; Jay Balagna; Jessie Riposo

title: State Firearm Laws and Suicide Prevention
description: More than 700 Vermont residents died of gunshot wounds from 2011 to 2020. Eighty-eight percent of these deaths were suicides. Although the full costs and benefits of gun laws are not known, how might firearm legislation affect Vermont’s suicide rate?
author: Andrew R. Morral

title: The Impact of the COVID-19 Pandemic on Workers with a Criminal History
description: In this article, we use data from the NLSY97 COVID-19 Supplement to examine the extent to which workers with a criminal history record had employment disruptions during the early months of the pandemic.
author: Daniel Schwam; Shawn D. Bushway; Jeffrey B. Wenger

title: Study to Support an Evaluation of the European Union Agency for Law Enforcement Training (CEPOL)
description: This is the final report of the study to support the European Commission's evaluation of the European Union Agency for Law Enforcement Training (CEPOL).
author: Shann Hulme; Emma Louise Blondes; Emma Disley; Niccolò Theodoli; Luca Marcolin; Sam Cole; Jirka Taylor; Lucy Gilder

title: Optimal Non-Pharmaceutical Pandemic Response Strategies Depend Critically on Time Horizons and Costs
description: This paper performs a large-scale optimization exercise to find optimal non-pharmaceutical pandemic response strategies.
author: Sarah A. Nowak; Pedro Nascimento de Lima; Raffaele Vardavas

title: Community Colleges Can Increase Credential Stacking by Introducing New Programs Within Established Technical Pathways
description: This study analyzes the introduction of new certificate or associate degree program options at Ohio community colleges during school years 2004–2005 to 2016–2017.
author: Drew M. Anderson; Lindsay Daugherty

title: The Research Case for Hiring People with Criminal History Records: California in Focus
description: This exploration of nationally relevant research findings will seek input from attendees on how to most effectively communicate research findings to employers. [Virtual]
author: RAND Corporation

title: Addressing Gun Violence Requires Better Means of Measuring It
description: Proposals to reduce firearm violence in the United States are often controversial, sometimes because there are no data demonstrating their effectiveness. The federal government has many of the requisite tools in place to collect the data, and it does it well …
author: Rosanna Smart; Andrew R. Morral

title: From Gatherer of Lands to Gravedigger: A Political Assessment of Putin's War on Ukraine
description: Putin's war in Ukraine is already redefining the entire international order. If the United States acts now, it may be able to influence the shape of the post-war geopolitical terrain.
author: John Tefft; Bruce McClintock; Khrystyna Holynska

title: Russia's Evolution Toward a Unified Strategic Operation
description: In this report, RAND researchers examine the reasons behind Russia's evolution toward a unified strategic operation, as well as the capabilities that would be necessary to execute key conventional offensive tasks in such an operation.
author: Clint Reach; Alyssa Demus; Michelle Grisé; Khrystyna Holynska; Christopher Lynch; Dara Massicot; David Woodworth

title: Will Logistics Be Russia's Undoing in Ukraine?
description: Russia's experience in Ukraine one year in is an example of what happens when a nation tries to fight a war without fully considering the logistics and sustainment that go alongside such a fight. The consequences for failing to fully consider these concepts d…
author: Bradley Martin

title: Senate Bill 9's Underwhelming First Year Shouldn't Be a Surprise; It Was by Design
description: In 2021, the California state Legislature passed legislation allowing a streamlined pathway for homeowners to produce duplexes and split lots. But a year after the law took effect, the resulting housing production pipeline looks to be trivial. Why has the law…
author: Jason M. Ward

title: State of the Union, Mental Health First Aid, China's Spy Balloon: RAND Weekly Recap
description: This weekly recap focuses on President Biden's State of the Union address, the benefits of mental health first aid training, insights on China’s spy balloon, and more.
author: RAND Corporation

title: U.S. Cannot Count on South Korea's Yoon to Line Up Against China
description: South Korean president Yoon Suk-yeol wants South Korea to become a global pivotal state that plays a valuable role in the international community. Turning this into reality will inevitably mean striking a balance between the United States and China.
author: Derek Grossman

title: How the Dutch Approached Brexit
description: The impact of Brexit on the Netherlands is significant. The Dutch government would have preferred the UK to stay in the EU. But despite all this, the Netherlands approached Brexit with relative clarity of purpose and the administration of the program brought …
author: Stijn Hoorens; Fook Nederveen

title: Prior Authorization Restrictions on Medications for Opioid Use Disorder
description: Researchers conducted a review of U.S. regulations and statutes between 2005 and 2019 related to medications for opioid use disorder to identify the frequency and types of prior authorization prohibitions in state laws.
author: Barbara Andraka-Christou; Olivia Golan; Rachel Totaram; Maggie Ohama; Brendan Saloner; Adam J. Gordon; Bradley D. Stein

title: Survey
description: How prevalent do zero-tolerance policies remain today? To find out, researchers surveyed 1,080 public school principals across the U.S.
author: Rachel Perera; Melissa Kay Diliberti

title: An Exploratory Analysis of Differential Prescribing of High-Risk Opioids by Insurance Type Among Patients Seen by the Same Clinician
description: The objective of this paper is to explore how high-risk opioid analgesic prescribing varies by payer type among patients seeing the same prescriber and identify clinician characteristics associated with variable prescribing.
author: Lucy B. Schulson; Andrew W. Dick; Yaou Flora Sheng; Bradley D. Stein

title: State of the Union 2023: Insights from RAND
description: In his second State of the Union address, President Joe Biden covered a wide range of issues facing the United States at home and abroad, including police violence, gun policy, Russia's war in Ukraine, and U.S. competition with China.
author: RAND Corporation

title: State Approaches to Tackling the Opioid Crisis Through the Health Care System
description: In this paper, policy experts discuss three broad strategies states are taking, through a variety of policy levers, to enhance the quality of and access to treatment for opioid use disorder.
author: Rosalie Liccardo Pacula; Bradley D. Stein

title: Do Early Care and Education Programs Improve When Enrolled in Quality Rating and Improvement Systems?
description: We investigated whether providers that participated in a county-level QRIS saw increases to their global quality (tier) rating, domain-specific quality ratings, and scores on an observation measure of classroom quality.
author: Celia J. Gomez; Anamarie A. Whitaker; Jill S. Cannon

title: Sustaining Global Leadership
description: Studies the strategic behavior of leading historical powers that faced rising challengers abroad and fiscal constraints at home and concludes with takeaways from case studies and discusses potential implications for American public policy.
author: Harun Dogo

title: Biliteracy Seals in a Large Urban District in New Mexico
description: This study examined the college readiness of students who earned different types of seals, the number of students who met some requirements for a seal but did not earn one, and the effect of earning a seal on college outcomes.
author: Kata Mihaly; Brenda Arellano; Shannon Prier

title: Large-Scale Training in Mental Health First Aid
description: In an evaluation of a city-wide effort to train New Yorkers in Mental Health First Aid, RAND researchers found that the majority of participants had used their skills to help friends, family, neighbors, and coworkers in the past six months.
author: Eunice C. Wong; Michael Stephen Dunbar; Daniel Siconolfi; Anthony Rodriguez; Chester Jean; Vanessa N. Torres; Rosemary Li; Michele Abbott; Ingrid Estrada-Darley; Lu Dong; Rebecca Weir

title: Flexible Opportunity Funding Investments in Delaware
description: The authors drew on surveys of Delaware local education agencies that received Opportunity Funding and describe the investments they made to improve the academic achievement of multilingual learners and students experiencing poverty.
author: Rebecca Ann Lawrence; Elizabeth D. Steiner; Pierrce Holmes; Heather L. Schwartz; Sy Doan

title: Evaluation of Delaware's Opportunity Funding and Student Success Block Grant Programs
description: The authors evaluated two Delaware programs for local education agencies with students experiencing poverty and multilingual learners during the 2019–2020 to 2021–2022 school years: Opportunity Funding and the Student Success Block Grant program.
author: Sy Doan; John Engberg; Sam Morales; Heather L. Schwartz; Lynn A. Karoly

title: Comparison of Public and Private Sector Cybersecurity and IT Workforces
description: The authors develop a common taxonomy based on work roles, key tasks, and responsibilities to examine the proportion of cybersecurity and information technology work roles, workers' salaries, and demand across private and public sectors.
author: Sasha Romanosky; Karen Schwindt; Ryan Johnson

title: Evaluation of Mental Health First Aid in New York City
description: More than 155,000 New Yorkers were trained in Mental Health First Aid between 2016 and 2020. They learned how to be active listeners, to provide reassurance and information, and to encourage professional care when appropriate. Most of the trainees ended up us…
author: Eunice C. Wong; Michael Stephen Dunbar; Daniel Siconolfi; Anthony Rodriguez; Chester Jean; Vanessa N. Torres; Rosemary Li; Michele Abbott; Ingrid Estrada-Darley; Lu Dong; Rebecca Weir

title: Japan's Long-Awaited Return to Geopolitics
description: In very short order, Japan moved to change decades of strategic thinking and embark on a new approach to security. The stark reality of geopolitics and the realization that what was once hypothetical is now possible were likely enough to convince Japan that t…
author: Jeffrey W. Hornung

title: Interdependence Across the National Critical Functions
description: Provides a novel interpretation of national critical functions to enhance their use for research by the risk analysis community.
author: Shannon Prier; Aaron Strong; Jonathan W. Welburn

title: Characterizing the Performance of Uncrewed Aircraft Systems
description: Analysts leveraged available data on performance of uncrewed aircraft system platforms to develop an approach to characterizing spray coverage as a function of payload, speed, endurance, and delivery and presenting performance parameters of interest.
author: Bradley Wilson; Shane Tierney; Rachel M. Burns

title: Considering Homeland Security Policy in the 118th Congress
description: What are the biggest homeland security policy issues facing the 118th Congress? RAND experts offer up insight on a variety of topics including cybersecurity, disaster preparedness and recovery, and terrorism and extremism, and more.
author: RAND Corporation

title: The War in Ukraine, Software Supply Chain Risk, 'Hacking Equity': RAND Weekly Recap
description: This weekly recap focuses on lessons about defense strategy from the war in Ukraine, U.S.-France cooperation in the Indo-Pacific, software supply chain risk, and more.
author: RAND Corporation

title: Trends in US Ambulatory Care Patterns During the COVID-19 Pandemic, 2019–2021
description: In this study, there was an increase in the return to expected rates of use of ambulatory care services between March 2020 and February 2021. This increase was lower for patients with Medicaid or Medicaid-Medicare dual eligibility.
author: John N. Mafi; Melody Craff; Sitaram Vangala; Thomas Pu; Dale Skinner; Cyrus Tabatabai-Yazdi; Anikia Nelson; Rachel O. Reid; Denis Agniel; Chi-Hong Tseng; Catherine A. Sarkisian; Cheryl L. Damberg; Katherine L. Kahn

title: Modifying Text Messages from a Faith-Based Physical Activity Intervention with Latino Adults in Response to the COVID-19 Pandemic
description: The purpose of this article is to describe how we developed and implemented a physical activity text messaging component within a faith-based intervention.
author: Margaret D. Whitley; Lilian Perez; Gabriela Castro; Anne Larson; Kathryn Pitkin Derose

title: A Tale of Two Wars and the Pitfalls of Success
description: Russia's war in Ukraine once again poses questions about how the United States prepares for conflict—not only which weapons it buys, but also how it envisions great-power wars in the 21st century. If the United States does learn the lessons of this war, then …
author: Raphael S. Cohen; Gian Gentile

title: How Can DoD Compare Damage Costs Against Resilience Investment Costs for Climate-Driven Natural Hazards?
description: This report assesses methods to compare the damage costs from climate change-related extreme weather events against the costs of investing in U.S. Department of Defense installation resilience.
author: Anu Narayanan; Patrick Mills; Tobias Sytsma; Kelly Klima; Rahim Ali

title: A Cost Estimating Framework for U.S. Marine Corps Joint Cyber Weapons
description: To help improve leadership decisionmaking related to the costs of offensive cyber operations acquisition, the authors developed a life-cycle cost-estimating framework for the U.S. Marine Corps and conducted exploratory modeling and simulation.
author: Bradley Wilson; Thomas Goughnour; Megan McKernan; Andrew Karode; Devin Tierney; Mark V. Arena; Michael J. D. Vermeer; Hansell Perez; Alexis Levedahl

title: A New Framework and Logic Model for Using Live, Virtual, and Constructive Training in the United States Air Force
description: To help improve training and readiness in the U.S. Air Force, the authors describe a framework for aligning live, virtual, and constructive capabilities with training needs on collective, complex, cognitive tasks for aircrews.
author: Timothy Marler; Susan G. Straus; Mark Toukan; Ajay K. Kochhar; Monica Rico; Christine Kistler LaCoste; Matt Strawn; Brian P. Donnelly

title: Preparing for Strategic Competition: The Need for Irregular Warfare Professional Military Education
description: The Department of Defense does not provide the irregular warfare professional military education necessary for success in competition and conflict in the 21st century. This is a not a new problem, but it is one that may deserve new attention from Congress and…
author: Charles T. Cleveland; Daniel Egel; David Maxwell; Hy Rothstein

title: Research Shows How Communities Are Prioritizing Health Equity
description: In partnership with RAND, the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation is tracking how communities are evolving their approaches to building a Culture of Health and advancing health equity. The research offers insights on how and why inequities develop, and more import…
author: Anita Chandra

title: Ann Korologos, Former U.S. Labor Secretary and RAND Corporation Chair, Dies at Age 81
description: The RAND Corporation was saddened to learn of the passing of Ann McLaughlin Korologos, a former U.S. Secretary of Labor and longtime member of the RAND family. Her distinguished career in the public, private, and nonprofit sectors included service as the chai…
author: RAND Corporation

title: Early Evaluation of the Children and Young People's Mental Health Trailblazer Programme
description: An early evaluation of the Children and Young People's Mental Health Trailblazer programme examines the development, implementation and early progress of the 25 mental health support teams created as the first step of the programme.
author: Jo Ellins; Lucy Hocking; Mustafa Al-Haboubi; Jennifer Newbould; Sarah-Jane Fenton; Kelly Daniel; Stephanie Stockwell; Brandi Leach; Manbinder Sidhu; Jennifer Bousfield; Gemma McKenna; Katie Saunders; Stephen O'Neill; Nicholas Mays

title: Navigating Political Tensions Over Schooling
description: Using survey data and interviews with superintendents, researchers investigate the extent to which polarization about issues such as race, sexuality, gender, and Covid-19 was interfering with schooling as of fall 2022.
author: Ashley E. Jochim; Melissa Kay Diliberti; Heather L. Schwartz; Katharine Destler; Paul T. Hill

title: Resilience in the Bayou
description: This film tells the story of how two organizations are supporting local communities in understanding, withstanding, and overcoming the multiple stressors brought on by the Deepwater Horizon disaster.
author: Janel Lowman; Melissa L. Finucane

title: Human Health and Socioeconomic Effects of the Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill in the Gulf of Mexico
description: The Deepwater Horizon oil spill is the only declared Spill of National Significance in U.S. history, and it significantly impacted the health of people and communities in the Gulf of Mexico region.
author: Paul Sandifer; Alesia Ferguson; Melissa L. Finucane; Melissa Partyka; Helena Solo-Gabriele; Ann Hayward Walker; Kateryna Wowk; Rex Caffey; David Yoskowitz

title: Perceived Need for Mental Health Treatment and the Mental Health Response to the COVID-19 Pandemic in the United States

author: Joshua Breslau; Carol S. North; Melissa L. Finucane; Elizabeth Roth; Rebecca L. Collins
